result.name: pupil_attainment_at_gcse_-_achieving_5_grade_a-c_by_school
result.notes:
Percentage of those aged 16 who get qualifications equivalent to 5 GCSEs at Grades A* to C by school

Source: Department for Children Schools and Families (DCSF)

Publisher: Department for Children Schools and Families (DCSF)

Geographies: County/Unitary Authority, Government Office Region (GOR)

Geographic coverage: England

Time coverage: 1994 to 2008

Type of data: Survey (census)

Notes: Data all relate to 15 year olds not 16 as in the target definition. The local and regional figures are based on data provided only by relevant maintained schools and discount pupils who have recently arrived from overseas.

odi-certificate.title: Pupil attainment at GCSE: Achieving 5+ grade A*-C by school

organization.name: department-for-children-schools-and-families
organization.title: Department for Children, Schools and Families
organization.description: DCFS is the department preceding DfE and its datasets are kept under the original name for historical purposes. Its datasets will surface in searches for DfE when the 'include sub-publishers' option is selected when searching from the DfE departmental page or when DfE is selected as a publisher in the filtering facets in the main search results page.

result.precision: The figures used to calculate the England average are based on figures provided by all relevant schools and include pupils from overseas. Therefore local and regional averages are not comparable with and will not sum to the national average.
result.title: Pupil attainment at GCSE: Achieving 5+ grade A*-C by school
